intro: Plagiobothrys californicus var. genuinus, commonly known as the California false flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
